intro: Sideritis pastoris var. laxiflora, commonly known as the loose-flowered ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Sideritis species are known for their medicinal properties, and this variety is no exception, containing compounds with potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
